issue.title: ign-cmake gz11 BUILD_TESTING still fails to build...
ign-cmake gz11 BUILD_TESTING still fails to build...

content.raw:
Please let us know what exact commands you're using to build.

On my machine (also Ubuntu 18.04) the following works just fine:

```
$ hg clone #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake
$ cd ign-cmake
$ hg up gz11
$ mkdir build
$ cd build
$ cmake .. -DBUILD_TESTING=ON
$ make
```

Although my default version of gcc is:

```
$ gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 8.2.0-1ubuntu2~18.04) 8.2.0
Copyright (C) 2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
```

but I can add `-DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc-7 -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=/usr/bin/g++-7` to my cmake command and everything still works fine.

`ign-cmake` is a pretty simple package of cmake modules, so I have to guess there's something funny about how you're calling the build commands. Are you making sure to configure your build outside the source directory?
content.html:
Please let us know what exact commands you're using to build.

On my machine (also Ubuntu 18.04) the following works just fine:

$ hg clone #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake
$ cd ign-cmake
$ hg up gz11
$ mkdir build
$ cd build
$ cmake .. -DBUILD_TESTING=ON
$ make

Although my default version of gcc is:

$ gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 8.2.0-1ubuntu2~18.04) 8.2.0
Copyright (C) 2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

but I can add -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/bin/gcc-7 -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=/usr/bin/g++-7 to my cmake command and everything still works fine.

ign-cmake is a pretty simple package of cmake modules, so I have to guess there's something funny about how you're calling the build commands. Are you making sure to configure your build outside the source directory?
